Mengintip Kelanjutan TPPI Jadi BUMN
05 Nov 2019, 07:28 by Vadhia Lidyana


Foto: Airlangga Hartarto (Antara Foto)

Jakarta - Trans Pacific Petrochemical Indotama (TPPI) beberapa hari lalu diusulkan untuk menjadi Badan Usaha Milik Negara (BUMN) kepada Presiden Joko Widodo (Jokowi). Usulan tersebut disampaikan oleh Menteri Koordinator Bidang Kemaritiman dan Investasi Luhut Binsar Pandjaitan.Menindaklanjuti usulan tersebut, hari ini Menteri Koordinator Bidang Perekonomian Airlangga Hartarto menggelar rapat koordinasi mengenai mengenai optimalisasi pengembangan TPPI.Sebelum memulai rapat, Airlangga mengatakan pihaknya akan melihat lagi bagaimana rencana pemerintah menjadikan TPPI sebagai BUMN. Menurutnya, secara teknis TPPI sudah menjadi bagian dalam BUMN karena saham terbesarnya dipegang oleh PT Pertamina (Persero)."Ini kita lihat dulu strukturnya, jadi kita bahas. Kan sudah menjadi bagian dari BUMN karena saham terbesarnya milik Pertamina. Nanti opsinya seperti apa kita lihat," kata Airlangga di kantornya, Jakarta, Selasa (5/11/2019).Lalu, usai rapat, Menteri BUMN Erick Thohir yang juga menghadiri agenda tersebut mengungkapkan, pemerintah akan melanjutkan proses re-strukturisasi TPPI ini. Erick mengatakan, Airlangga yang akan memberikan keputusan terkait proses re-strukturisasi tersebut dalam waktu dua minggu."Pokoknya prosesnya akan berjalan re-structuring segala. Tapi nanti menunggu beliau (Airlangga) dalam dua minggu," jelas Erick.Dalam kesempatan yang sama, Direktur Jenderal Kekayaan Negara Isa Rachmatawarta mengungkapkan, pada rakor tersebut pihaknya memberikan laporan mengenai kelanjutan utang multi years bond (MYB) TPPI yang akan diselesaikan melalui konversi. Dengan konversi tersebut, maka pemerintah akan memiliki saham TPPI sebesar 95,9%."Ya sejauh ini Presiden kan sudah mengeluarkan Peraturan Pemerintah (PP) mengenai konversi MYB menjadi saham kan sudah ditetapkan dengan PP. Nanti kita perlu RUPS, untuk mengesahkan konversi itu. Setelah itu kita jadi memilikinya sebanyak 95,9%," terang Isa.Menurut Isa, proses kelanjutan status TPPI menjadi BUMN ini akan lebih diarahkan ke penerbitan saham baru (right) issue TPPI ke PT Pertamina (Persero). "Nggak, kita kayaknya kita akan segera tahap keduanya kan kita akan mendorong dia right issue ke Pertamina. Jadi kayaknya dari pada kita repot ke BUMN, jadi kayaknya mungkin kita percepat saja right issue-nya," imbuh dia.Sebagai informasi, sebelumnya, Menteri Koordinator Kemaritiman dan Investasi Luhut Binsar Panjaitan telah mengusulkan agar TPPI dijadikan sebagai badan usaha milik negara (BUMN)."TPPI juga tadi sudah kita usulin supaya jadi BUMN sendiri. Sudah tadi sudah diperintahkan, kita akan buat. Dan paling penting orang yang menghambat proses pembangunannya itu akan diganti," kata Luhut dalam rapat terbatas (ratas) di Istana Presiden, Jakarta, Rabu (30/10/2019).Perlu diketahui, PT Tuban Petrochemical Industries (TPI) yang merupakan induk TPPI telah resmi dikuasai oleh pemerintah. Hal itu ditandai dengan penyuntikan penyertaan modal negara (PMN) sebesar Rp 2,6 triliun.Suntikan modal itu ditandai dengan penandatanganan Peraturan Pemerintah (PP) Nomor 66 Tahun 2019 tentang Penambahan Penyertaan Modal Negara Republik Indonesia ke dalam Modal Saham PT Tuban Petrochemical Industries oleh Presiden Joko Widodo.Dengan penambahan modal itu mengakibatkan jumlah modal Negara Republik Indonesia pada PT Tuban Petrochemical Industries menjadi senilai Rp 2,9 triliun atau setara 175.406 lembar saham dengan porsi kepemilikan 95,9%. text:
Take a peek at the Continuation of the TPPI to become a BUMN
05 Nov 2019, 07:28 by Vadhia Lidyana


Photo: Airlangga Hartarto (Between Photos)

Jakarta - Trans Pacific Petrochemical Indotama (TPPI) a few days ago it was proposed to become a State-Owned Enterprise (BUMN) to President Joko Widodo (Jokowi). The proposal was submitted by the Coordinating Minister for Maritime Affairs and Investment Luhut Binsar Pandjaitan. Following up on the proposal, today the Coordinating Minister for Economic Affairs Airlangga Hartarto held a coordination meeting on optimizing TPPI development. as a BUMN. According to him, technically TPPI has become a part of BUMN because its largest share is held by PT Pertamina (Persero). "We will see the structure first, so we will discuss it. It has already become a part of BUMN because Pertamina owns the largest shares. Later, what options will we see? "Airlangga said in his office, Jakarta, Tuesday (11/5/2019). Then, after the meeting, SOE Minister Erick Thohir who also attended the agenda revealed, the government would continue the process of restructuring the TPPI. Erick said, Airlangga will give a decision related to the restructuring process within two weeks. "The process will be re-structured, everything will be done. But then wait for him (Airlangga) in two weeks," said Erick. On the same occasion, the Director State Wealth General Isa Rachmatawarta revealed, on the coordination meeting, his party gave a report on the continuation of TPPI's multi-year debt (MYB) debt to be settled through conversion. With this conversion, the government will have a 95.9% TPPI share. "Yes so far the President has issued a Government Regulation (PP) regarding the conversion of MYB into shares, which has been determined by PP. Later we need a GMS, to authorize the conversion. After that we will have 95.9% ownership, "Isa explained. According to Isa, the process of continuing the TPPI status to become a BUMN will be directed towards the issuance of TPPI issue to PT Pertamina (Persero). "No, we seem to be going to the second stage right, we will push him to the right issue to Pertamina. So it seems like we are bothering the SOEs, so I think we might just speed up the right issue," he added. As information, previously, the Minister Maritime and Investment Coordinator Luhut Binsar Panjaitan has proposed that the TPPI be made a state-owned enterprise (BUMN). "We have also been instructing TPPI to become a state-owned enterprise. We have already ordered it, we will make it. it will be replaced, "Luhut said in a limited meeting (ratas) at the Presidential Palace, Jakarta, Wednesday (10/30/2019). Please note, PT Tuban Petrochemical Industries (TPI) which is the parent of TPPI has been officially controlled by the government. This was marked by the injection of state capital investment (PMN) of Rp 2.6 trillion. The capital injection was marked by the signing of Government Regulation (PP) Number 66 of 2019 concerning Addition of the State Capital of the Republic of Indonesia into the share capital of PT Tuban Petrochemical Industries by the President Joko Widodo.With the addition of capital, the total capital of the Republic of Indonesia at PT Tuban Petrochemical Industries amounted to Rp 2.9 trillion or 175,406 shares with a share of 95.9% ownership.
